result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Kollauf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with each other 13CF342, 14CF85, and 14CF111

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs, restitution, and supervisions fees.   25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

*Amended to reflect $0 restitution owed.*
Comply with same conditions as stated in 13CF342 count 1.

State has 30 days to submit a restitution order with copies to be forward to all parties, if objections, must file written objection w/in 30 days pursuant to statutes and a hearing to be heard by Court Commissioner.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Kollauf

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing held 10/1/14
(original filed in 13CF342)

1:28 pm
Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 13CF342, 14CF85,  and 14CF111.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report.  Atty Dalkert states corrections to the PSI report on the record.  (Court informs that the list with 29 names being under the age of 18 and list will be sealed in the file-were not charged but were read-in.) K. M., mother of victim A.R.M. provides two photos of the victim, that are marked as exhibit P#1 and P#2, and makes statements to the court.  
(Court informs that the exhibits P#1 and P#2 will be sealed in the record as well).
ADA Cousins makes sentencing statements and recommendation:
13CF342 - 948.02(2) 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - Ct 1: Prison at 6 yrs Incarceration and 8 years Extended Supervision with sentences to run all concurrent with each other.  LIfetime sex offender registration.  
14CF342 - 948.11(2)(a)1 Harmful Material to Child - Ct 4: Prison at 1.5 yrs Incarceration and 2 yrs Extended Supervision, concurrent with each other.  Request of 30 days to figure restitution amounts for remaining cases.
14CF85 - 948.02(2) 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - Ct 1: Prison at 6 yrs Incarceration and 8 years Extended Supervision
14CF111 948.02(2) 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - Ct 1: Prison at 6 yrs Incarceration and 8 years Extended Supervision
Atty Dalkert makes statements and recommends for Jail/Probation or lesser prison system. 228 days credit (159 days credit for 13CF342)
Court requests clairifcation: 4 victims of sexual intercourse and the 29 victims were exposed to sexual materials.
Defendant makes apologetic statements to the Court.

BTC:**************************PRISON***********
13CF342 - 948.02(2) 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - Ct 1:  
Prison at 5 yrs 6 mo Incarceration and 6 years 6 mo Extended Supervision with sentences to run all concurrent with each other.  228 credit for each case. No contact with victims, their residences, or family.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18, unless approved by the Agent, exception of family members unless the Department has other rules not allowing it.  Comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program (SORP) for life.  Comply with the face to face registration with the local law enforcement.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment, unless approved by Agent. Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.    AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Not to associate with anyone using alcohol or drugs or have contact wit anyone under avtive community supervision without prior agent approval.  Comply with Sex Offender Treatment. Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  Comply with all the after care treatment recommendations from the alcohol treatment program received in prison.  Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  No access to internet, camera or cell phone without agent approval.  Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Pay costs. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by your agent. Pay restitution, costs, and supervision fees as directed by Agent and at 25 % pay from prison account.  Pay Restitution: $2,928.80. State will have 30 days to submit a restitution order with copies to be forward to all parties, if objections, must file written objection w/in 30 days pursuant to statutes and a hearing to be heard by Court Commissioner.

14CF342 - 948.11(2)(a)1 Harmful Material to Child - Ct 4: 
Prison at 1 yrs 6 mo Incarceration and 2 years Extended Supervision with sentences to run all concurrent with each other.  228 credit for each case. Comply with same conditons as in 13CF342 Ct 1. Pay costs.

14CF85  -  948.02(2) 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - Ct 1:
Prison at 5 yrs 6 mo Incarceration and 6  years 6 mo Extended Supervision with sentences to run all concurrent with each other.  228 credit for each case. Comply with same conditons as in 13CF342 Ct 1. Pay costs.

14CF111 - 948.02(2) 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - Ct 1:  
Prison at 5 yrs 6 mo Incarceration and 6 years 6 mo Extended Supervision with sentences to run all concurrent with each other.  228 credit for each case. Comply with same conditons as in 13CF342 Ct 1. Pay costs. 

Appeal infor provided.
Written determinate form completed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard:  13CF342, 14CF60, 14CF85, 14CF110, 14CF111

State files Amended Information in 14CF111. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  There are 34 counts that are to be Uncharged Read-Ins.  A list is provided to the Court. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  With the understanding the defense will be arguing at sentencing.  Asks for 10 days to view the uncharged read-ins and if any objection, she would do that within 10 days. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF342 Count 1 - GUILTY
13CF342 Count 4 - GUILTY
14CF85 - GUILTY

Atty Dalkert received the Amended Information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF111 Count 1 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following:  
13CF342 Counts 1 & 4
14CF85 
14CF111 Count 1
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

Dismissed and Read-in:
13CF342 Counts 2 & 3
14CF60 All Counts
14CF110 All Counts
14CF111 Count 2

There are 34 uncharge read-ins.  Those individual names of the minors have been listed for the purpose of identity so jeopardy would attach. 
These names are to be sealed and not part of the court file or public record.  These are not to be scanned either. 

Court orders PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 9/17/2014, with copies forwarded to Counsel. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.

Defendant has 2 weeks to go thru the uncharged read-ins to verify what they believe they should be.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on July 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
of Preliminary Hearing on 04-11-14 - Original filed in 14CF111

Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in court with attorney Melissa H Dalkert. Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF342, 14CF60, 14CF85, 14CF110, 14CF111

14CF60:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

14CF85:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

14CF110:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

14CF111:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Atty Dalkert makes arguments regarding bond.  Asks for one bond that will cover all of the files.  Currently a signature bond on 13CF342 and a $10,000 cash bond on 14CF60 & 14CF85 and a separate $10,000 cash bond on 14CF110 & 14CF111.  Asks for a cash bond to cover all files.  He may be working at a gutter business.  Will be working 35 to 40 hours a week.   Agrees to have no access to the internet or items that could connect to the internet including things like the Xbox.  
Atty Cousins makes arguments to the bond request.  Has no specific objection so long as each of the conditions are encompassed in the new complete bond.  Opposes the modification of the amount of bond. 
Atty Dalkert makes additional arguments to the Court.  Asks for a wage assignment after $1,500 cash is posted. 
Atty Cousins makes additional arguments to the Court.  Another file is pending with numerous counts anticipated. 

BY THE COURT: 
Bond and conditions of bond that were originally set by Judge Finn in these matters is appropriate and the modification is denied. 

Atty Dalkert makes statements.  Asks the Court to combine to all one file.  
Court questions Atty Dalkert. 

BY THE COURT: 
$10,000 cash bond set: 
Covers all 5 files: 13CF342, 14CF60, 14CF85, 14CF110, 14CF111
No contact with A.R.M.  11-17-98.  
No contact with unrelated juvenile females.  
No use of cell phone camera or any camera type devices.  
Defendant is allowed to go on his trip on 10-04- to 10-14-2013 as planned.
No contact with females under 18 years of age that are non-household members.
No contact with B.M.P. or H.C.D.
Not possess or have acces to any electronic device that has ability to connect to internet.
Not use any device that has a camera capability. 
Not possess any cameras. 
Court will allow family to have a computer in the home provided it is password protected and the defendent does not have the password or access to use the device. 
Comply with terms of bond in 13CF342. 
No contact with L.E.L 3/19/97 or H.C.D. 9/26/98
Additional conditions:  Day Report Drug and Alcohol free 3 times per week. 
Has to reside with his parents.

From JVF to TTF based on prior case assignments.  Approved by TTF.
Arraignment on April 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in court with attorney Melissa H Dalkert. Defendant Tyler J Kollauf in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 13CF-342, 14CF-60, 14CF-85, 14CF-110 and 14CF-111.

1:51 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a preliminary hearing at this time.
Atty Cousins states 13CF-342 already had a bind over, the remaining files are set for a preliminary hearing.

Both parties are prepared to proceed.

1:52 PM Jeff Coey is called and sworn in, Detective with Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins, from oldest to newest case.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Atty Dalkert provides to the Court and Prosecutor a chart of the files and victims, for easier reference.
Direct examination continues by Atty Cousins.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff. (Exhibit list placed in 13CF-342).
Exhibit #2 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff.
2:22 PM Cross-examination by Atty Dalkert, from oldest to newest case.
2:34 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
2:36 PM Re-cross by Atty Dalkert.

Court takes judicial notice of the bond in 13CF-342.
Exhibits will not be moved into evidence and not be received.

Court finds there is probable cause a crime was commited and Defendant has committed it, in 14CF-60, 85, 110 and 111.
Case is bound over for arraignment, proceedings and trial. 

Court addresses the fact that two Judges were assigned to cases listed above.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued on all cases. 

State will forward discovery to Defense prior to arraignment hearing.
All 5 files should be heard by one Judge.

Court reviews the cases regarding bond. 

BY THE COURT:
***Minutes sheet in 14CF-85 should be also put in 14CF-60, from February 17, 2014***.  
***$10,000 cash bond should be covered by both 14CF-60 and 14CF-85. Bond may be amended to reflect this***.

State has filed informations to the Court and to Defense.

Bond in all cases are continued.

Atty Dalkert states that the State will provide her discovery prior to the arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

13CF342 to also track with cases today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Melissa Dalkert appears in Court.  Parents have retained her to represent the defendant on this case. 

ADA Cass Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Sexual Assault of a Child.
Atty Dalkert makes statements to the Court.  Reserves bond argument. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Cousins recommends a $20,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Dalkert makes bond arguments to the Court. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  March 3, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
